oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons on December 19, 2011, at the Montgomery County Archives. He is holding the camera he used in Vietnam. Ammons wears a cap with a patch reading, "1st Infantry 1965-1970 Vietnam." The nickname of the First Infantry Division is the "The Big Red One."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cameras; Men
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Montgomery County (Tenn.); United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st.; Vietnam War, 1961-197
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970. His photographs show details of the daily life of soldiers in Vietnam.
